entry.title: Fix QuotaDatabase::EnsureOpened() reentrant nested txn
entry.content:
It is possible for EnsureOpened() to be reentrant where ResetStorage()

or {EnsureDatabaseVersion() => QuotaDatabaseMigrations::UpgradeSchema()

=> ResetStorage()} calls back to EnsureOpened().



This changes EnsureDatabaseVersion() to no longer call ResetStorage(),

but to return false. EnsureOpened() will already call ResetStorage()

when either OpenDatabase() or EnsureDatabaseVersion() fails, but now

it will return immediately if ResetStorage() succeeds.



This bug was discovered when tast test

hwsec.CrossVersionChromeLogin.tmp2_r88 restores a version 5 database and

CrxInstaller is the first code path to touch QuotaDatabase and calls

Commit() with the nested transaction which causes DCHECKs to fail.



Change-Id: I622982f49d987b21d50e0c38ee86b70a6d072a53

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4805623

Reviewed-by: Evan Stade

Commit-Queue: Joel Hockey

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1187583}

entry.title: fws: Add additional metrics for success/failure
entry.content:
Add additional metrics to determine rate of success. This is done

by checking how many times we initialize fws v2 and how many times

we record a fws launch + no template found. At the moment there is

no way to determine if LaunchAppsFromTemplate has any failures

that can lead to a blocking launch, so this is the best way to

determine it at the moment.



BUG=b:297251580

TEST=FloatingWorkspaceServiceTest*

entry.title: [MappableSI] Implement ScopedMapping.
entry.content:
1. Add a new interface MapSharedImage() to SharedImageInterface

which will map the shared image mailbox to CPU visible memory so

that clients can read/write to that memory.

This call issues a blocking/sync call to service side on the

client's thread until the GpuMemoryBufferHandle and other

metadata arrives back from the service side. This info is

then cached in SharedImageInterface so avoid blocking in future.



2. Add a new class ScopedMapping which will be used to manage

map/unmap and other access to underlying native buffer or shared

memory. Implement client and service side changes for it.



Bug: 1433317,1433318

Change-Id: I7f775ecef15eda497c13de1ce86fa51bf42fc3d1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4775830

the view.

entry.title: [NP] Use mojom AbslStatusCode in Nearby Presence
entry.content:
Previously we were only communicating success and failure scenarios

instead of passing the full status code information from

the utility process to the browser process. Now that we have a copy of

the AbslStatusCode to use in the browser process, that is used instead. The AbslStatusCode is used to pipe the status across the mojom pipe. A super set of the status code is also added to be used by the nearby presence service to communicate with the presence clients.

entry.title: [tools] Don't remove empty directories
entry.content:
Git creates empty directories for uninitilized git submodules. If such

directory gets removed (e.g. via rmdir), git will identify that as

removing git submodule.



When tools/remove_stale_pyc_files.py runs on tools/, and if src_internal

checkout is set to false, it results in removing tools/perf/data and

having dirty state (deleted: tools/perf/data).

entry.title: [EditContext] Remove Color fields from TextFormat
entry.content:
The TextFormat [1] object associated with a TextFormatUpdateEvent [2]

has 3 color-related fields: textColor, backgroundColor, and

underlineColor. Most of the time the developer shouldn't use these, and

should instead leave the text's color unchanged when applying other

formats like underline thickness. But, there's no indication

to authors when they

should apply the values in these fields and when they should not.



There needs to be a change to the API surface to make this clear.

However, there currently aren't clear use cases for these fields.

The EditingWG resolved [3] to just remove them until there's a

better understood use case.



Hence, remove the fields in this CL.



[1] https://w3c.github.io/edit-context/#dom-textformat

[2] https://w3c.github.io/edit-context/#textformatupdateevent

[3] https://github.com/w3c/edit-context/issues/54#issuecomment-1678233526

entry.title: Don't let WebUI events cross the incognito barrier.
entry.content:
WebUI events use the same dispatch mechanism as extensions. Extensions

have a mechanism to allow some extension events to cross the incognito

barrier. These checks were inadvertently being skipped for WebUI and

webpages.



This CL adds the check for WebUI and webpages to enforce that no events

cross the incognito boundary. This CL updates SettingsPrivateEventRouter

to attach a browser context to the generated event.

entry.title: SiteInstance eligibility check for back navigation prerendering
entry.content:
After discussions about how to architect session history prerendering

w.r.t. SiteInstances, we're now considering reusing the back

navigation entry's existing SiteInstance. To do so, we would not be

able to prerender when the SiteInstance has related active content

(i.e. an active document with the same BrowsingInstance). We add a

new eligibility check for this case.



We include tests of several scenarios where the the target back

navigation entry would (or would not) have the same BrowsingInstance

as active content. The test fixture for the session history

prerendering tests is now parameterized on whether the browser or renderer initiates the navigation away from the entry to be

prerendered, as this is one factor which affects whether a navigation

swaps BrowsingInstances. Various helper methods are updated to no

longer assume a single WebContents.



Bug: 1422266

entry.title: Shared Storage: Add iframe attribute for response header writes
entry.content:
We include the previously added mixin interface

`HTMLSharedStorageWritableElementUtils` with boolean attribute

`sharedStorageWritable` in `HTMLIFrameElement`.



The value of the IDL attribute is plumbed to the new field

`blink::mojom::IframeAttributes::shared_storage_writable`, and then

`blink::mojom::LocalFrameHost::DidChangeIframeAttributes()` notifies `FrameTreeNode` the attribute value is parsed or changes.



We add infra to `NavigationRequest` and `NavigationRequestInfo` to

check PermissionsPolicy and plumb the writable value to

`network::ResourceRequest`.



Since the `URLLoaderNetworkContext::Type` for iframe navigations is

`URLLoaderNetworkContext::Type::kServiceWorkerContext` (https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:content/browser/storage_partition_impl.cc;drc=b27071598a6b291a7319d99ce7aa4af81ebc060f;l=3329), we have to use a workaround to send a

`RenderFrameHost` to `SharedStorageHeaderObserver::HeaderReceived()`.



Hence we add

`network::ResourceRequest::TrustedParams::shared_storage_writable_id`, which in the case of (eligible) iframe navigations will be the

existing `NavigationRequest::navigation_id_`, and otherwise -1. This

long integer is sent over mojom and can thus be sent back again via

`URLLoaderNetworkServiceObserver::OnSharedStorageHeaderReceived()` in

order to identify and defer a header's operations, which will then be

looked up by id and invoked on iframe commit.



This is part of a project to add support to writing to shared storage

from response headers. See

https://github.com/WICG/shared-storage/pull/70 for more information

and https://crrev.com/c/4691573 for a prototype for adding image and

iframe attributes.



Browser tests are added in https://crrev.com/c/4718688.



Bug: 1434529,1218540

entry.title: Prevent soft keyboards from force-autocorrecting user text.
entry.content:
When the user presses an editable field and no hardware keyboard is

available, soft keyboard is called up.



The soft keyboard needs to learn information about the field it is

attached to (e.g. is it just a numpad entry? is it a password?) and

creates its ui and behavior accordingly.



One of these signals is TYPE_TEXT_FLAG_NO_SUGGESTIONS, which says "do

not autocorrect this edit field", which certain popular keyboards

ignore.



One way to circumvent this is to give some other details to the soft

keyboard that may cause them to behave in a desired way, however these

details also alter the behavior of the Editor.



This change creates a "split" so that

- Editor treats its contents as text, allowing users to select

individual words, and

- Keyboard treats its contents as URI, preveinting it from

autocorrecting the content.



Change-Id: I4ad3d3272dd5820b6623ca82a21b6c094edf1433

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4804723

Auto-Submit: Tomasz Wiszkowski

Reviewed-by: Patrick Noland

Commit-Queue: Tomasz Wiszkowski

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Replace PDFWebContentsHelper with PDFDocumentHelper
entry.content:
In this CL:

1. Instead of using WebContentsUserData, use DocumentUserData for

PDFWebContentsHelper.

2. Remove initializing PDFWebContentsHelper as a Tab helper and a

WebContents helper. Initialize it when binding a PDF service.

3. Rename all references from PDFWebContentsHelper to

PDFDocumentHelper.

4. Update formatting using git cl format.



With the OOPIF PDF Viewer project, multiple PDF Viewers embedded on a

single page will share the same WebContents, causing collisions for any

uses of WebContentsUserData. Multiple PDF Viewers will not share the

same blink::Document, though, so DocumentUserData is safe to use.



There should be no visible change for the existing PDF Viewer that uses

MimeHandlerViewGuest, where each PDF Viewer has its own WebContents.



Bug: 1445746

Change-Id: I83da8d02ebc2c823eb0624de79e1ebe0fc1c9a32

entry.title: [rebaseline-cl] Do not treat builds without failures as missing
entry.content:
An empty results check is no longer necessary after we added a more

robust mechanism to detect incomplete builds (crbug.com/1123077). That

check is causing `rebaseline-cl` to incorrectly report builders that

only fail on non-web test suites to be as "missing".



A follow-up change will deal with a separate bug in the fill-missing

behavior.

Test: git cl issue 4795287

Test: blink_tool.py rebaseline-cl --no-trigger-jobs --patchset=8

entry.title: Support fractional coordinates in DCLayerOverlayParams content_rect
entry.content:
We already support fractional scaling and offsets for the visual content

in a DComp subtree. This CL makes it so callers of DCLayerTree can

specify non-integral content rects.



This is a case that can happen for delegated compositing when cc submits

a frame with a tile quad that is both scaled and occluded in such a way

that the part of its image that is visible does not fall on exact pixel

boundaries.

entry.title: [SurfacePolish] Adjust the vertical margin of MV tiles and Single tab card module on tablet
entry.content:
This CL fixed the following two problems:

1. Adjust the vertical margin of MV tiles and Single tab card module on the tablet to avoid them overlapping with each other.

2. Fix the problem of having a blank space on the page when there is no tile element in the MV tiles. Since the MV tiles module has top and bottom paddings, we need to make it invisible when there is no tile element in it.

entry.title: Revert the ordering of MIDI and MIDI_SYSEX
entry.content:
To the state before

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4410060 .



This cosmetic change turned out to have a side effect. While

HostContentSettingsMap stores values keyed by the setting's name,

the UnusedSitesPermissionsService stores the list of revoked permissions

to be shown in the UI in a way that is keyed by their ordinal number.



We'll need to migrate this service to use the settings' names.



In the meantime, the order needs to be reverted, so that we don't show

the wrong list of revoked permissions in the UI; and new settings should

only be added to the end of the enum.



Bug: 1459305

entry.title: [Tab Restore] Fix issues with DIRTY State and Lazy Tab Init
entry.content:
testOpenRecentlyClosedEntry_Group_FromGroupClosure_WithRestart has been

failing for a while.



A recent change

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4791023

fixed the original cause of the flakes, but the test is now

consistently failing for other reasons.



Reason 1 - The TabCreationState for tabs launched with a WebContents

without a renderer (mainly those with LaunchType FROM_RECENT_TABS)

should be FROZEN_FOR_LAZY_LOAD. Doing so forces TabStateAttributes to

mark the Tab as DIRTY and saves the TabState. This is necessary because

without a renderer these WebContents may skip triggering typical

UNTIDY -> DIRTY transitions. They also skip lazy saves since there is

no onLoadStopped signal for a low priority save. FROZEN_FOR_LAZY_LOAD

was hardcoded correctly in createTabWithWebContents when calling

TabModel#addTab, but was incorrect when actually building the tab with

an existing WebContents. This CL adds a new type of TabBuilder to

address this.



Reason 2 - The TabStateAttributes may demote the current tab from

DIRTY, which is set for Reason 1, to UNTIDY. This is incorrect

since DIRTY should only transition to CLEAN. Transitioning to UNTIDY

risks loss of state since forced saves due to DIRTY may be dropped.

This happens because the navigation entries are changed sometime after

the DIRTY state being initially set, but before the TabPersistentStore

attempts to commit a save. I have a stack trace, but did not dig any

deeper. See crbug.com/1474927 for stack. Note that we also need to

properly reset the TabState to clean if a tab save is blocked in

TabPersistentStore#addTabToSaveQueue to ensure it eventually is saved.



Bug: 1474927, 1419539, 1403661

Change-Id: Id25c887e08a5036e219aa19332dd0db8968e742d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4803409

entry.content:
This reverts commit 3b07db635cacc546aa32fdd3cfae297291134651.



Reason for revert: BackgroundInfo::* checks may not be sufficient for determining the target of the event dispatch.



Original change's description:

> [Extensions] Create service worker event dispatch to renderer metric.

>

> Extensions.Events.DispatchToSendToRenderer.ExtensionServiceWorker

> Extensions.Events.DispatchToSendToRenderer.ExtensionEventPage

> Extensions.Events.DispatchToSendToRenderer.ExtensionBackgroundPage

>

> This metric measures the time it takes from the start of event dispatch

> in the event router (browser) until the event is dispatched to the

> renderer. It is meant to help assess what share of pre-renderer

> (vs post-renderer) time is spent when dispatching events.

entry.title: [mac immersive fs] don't toggle toolbar visibility on window re-ordering
entry.content:
Re-ordering a child window involves adding and removing it from its

parent (crbug.com/1324216) and it caused spurious toolbar visibility

change. This is harmful because it results in dialog anchoring to a

wrong position.



This CL does the following

- stops firing window add and remove observer on window re-ordering.

- renames `reallyOrderWindow` to `orderWindowByShuffling` for clarity.

- adds `isShufflingForOrdering` property to window.



Hopefully this will reduce the chance of other bugs related to window

re-ordering in fullscreen.



This is the part 1 of dialog positioning fix. Follow-ups will address

wrong calculation in BrowserViewLayout.

entry.title: Strip GestureDetector.
entry.content:
The change removes GestureDetector used to differentiate between

Omnibox taps and long-presses.



Long-press gesture has lost all its meaning back when we introduced

Search Ready Omnibox and Clipboard support: the omnibox comes up empty

(meaning the user cannot use the gesture to select all its content),

and cannot use this gesture to directly paste into the omnibox (it's

never been directly supported; we have dedicated actions for that).



As such, the long-press on the Omnibox does nothing else than focus

the Omnibox.



The change simplifies metrics reporting and obsoletes the

OmniboxFocusReason.OmniboxLongClick action.



The change further simplifies the focus flow by removing "set and

reset omnibox text": upon Focus event, LocationBarMediator no longer

sets the Omnibox text content (which next had to be cleared by the

EditUrlSuggestionProcessor). Instead, the LocationBarMediator supplies

an empty input right from the start. This works the same way the

current logic does, skipping one extra content setting, and

simplifying some of the Omnibox interfaces.

entry.title: DisplayLinkMac: Allow multi-threaded use
entry.content:
Split DisplayLinkMac into two parts: DisplayLinkMac and

DisplayLinkMacSharedState.



There is only one DisplayLinkMacSharedState per CGDirectDisplayID,

and that instance is shared across all threads.



There can be multiple DisplayLinkMacs with the same CGDirectDisplayID,

on different threads, that all point to one DisplayLinkMacSharedState

internally. Change DisplayLinkMacs to be RefCounted instead of

RefCountedThreadSafe, to reflect this.



Most of the diffs of the patch moves code from DisplayLinkMac into the

new DisplayLinkMacSharedState class.



There are three locks in play in this area. They can be acquired only

in the following order:

- The DisplayLinkMacSharedState::display_link_running_lock_

- This coordinates between multiple threads's requests that the

CVDisplayLink be started or stopped.

- The macOS CVDisplayLink lock

- This is already held during the CVDisplayLink callback

- This is taken during several CVDisplayLink API calls (for

simplicity, assume it is taken by all of them).

- The DisplayLinkGlobals::lock

- This guards access to: (1) the CGDirectDisplayID to

DisplayLinkMacSharedState map (2) the per DisplayLinkMacSharedState



Additionally, instead of having VSyncCallbackMac hold an explicit

reference to its DisplayLinkMac and then call the (private) method

UnregisterCallback, make the reference be implicit in an unregister

callback object. This is just to avoid having every class here be

a friend of every other class, which seemed unsanitary.



Bug: 1404797

Change-Id: Ib1e1c85a06f9608ab07120762e4cfe01c6977a8f

entry.title: Run HangWatcher in zygote children
entry.content:
On Linux and ChromeOS, the HangWatcher never runs in zygote children

(renderers, gpu process, and some utility processes) because it's

only called in ContentMainRunnerImpl::RunBrowser() and

RunOtherNamedProcessTypeMain(), neither of which run in zygote children.



It does get initialized on the main thread because that is run in

ChromeMainDelegate::CommonEarlyInitialization(), which is called

from RunZygote().



The Linux sandbox cannot be started in a multithreaded process, so

the children that need to apply a sandbox will only start the

HangWatcher after applying the sandbox.



Use of the HangWatcher in zygote children is gated by a new

EnableHangWatcherInZygoteChildren base::Feature.



Bug: 1290880, 1079808

Change-Id: I553004b2002f5c193e7366c9699b891714f687e8

entry.title: Revert "Switch which builders are running the cr23_* gtests."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 205dd7d5447657e6a68a44a7db1ad25e548bed92.



Reason for revert: Likely culprit CL causing test failures in step "cr23_views_unittests on Ubuntu-22.04" on builder "chromium/ci/Linux Tests"





Original change's description:

> Switch which builders are running the cr23_* gtests.

>

> We want the cr23_* gtests to be run only once per platform, and

> sheriffed on the main waterfalls. So, this CL changes things so

> that cr23_browser_tests, cr23_interactive_ui_tests, and cr23_views_unittests

> are only run on 'Linux Tests', 'Win10 Tests x64', and 'Mac13 Tests' (on

> 100% of jobs), and only in CI, not on the CQ.

>

> Bug: 1444855, b/296624172

> Change-Id: Iecc112aebad4e7ba1e466017b864885207da45a2

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4804407

entry.title: Cleanup: move TestPrintJob into print_view_manager_unittest.cc
entry.content:
Class TestPrintJob is very restricted in capabilities, and is only used

by the unit tests in print_view_manager_unittest.cc. Move this class

into that file. This frees up TestPrintJob in the printing namespace,

to allow for a more capable testing class to be added for use by

browser tests.

entry.title: Cleanup protobuf usages in Client Side Phishing model.
entry.content:
CSD-Phishing models used to be under a protobuf format for some

platforms, which required a separate CSD-Phishing classification scorer

object to extract the files. The Android and Desktop models have all

been packaged under flatbuffer format to simplify model management and

code complexity.

entry.title: [ChromeRefresh2023] NTB and Tab Search buttons Fitt's law support.
entry.content:
NTB/TSB now handle clicks up to the top of the tab strip region (and therefore the top of the frame) in maximized windows. To do this, they now apply a custom hit test mask, and their bounds are extended vertically to cover the entire tab strip region, with insets to vertically center them.



Some fixes were needed now that the buttons have nonzero insets:

- They get a custom highlight path generator, so the inkdrops and focus rings consider insets and overridden corner radius.

- Background painting respects insets.

- Preferred size respects insets.

entry.title: [Fuchsia] use -t to specify how long ffx should wait for stopping daemon
entry.content:
Otherwise it may randomly throw exceptions like:



```

ERROR 2023-08-09 13:15:05,956 ../../third_party/fuchsia-sdk/sdk/tools/x64/ffx daemon stop failed with returncode 1.

ERROR 2023-08-09 13:15:05,956 stdout of the command: No wait behavior specified -- not waiting for daemon to stop.

** The daemon may not have exited. To wait for it to exit,

** specify -w or -t timeout_ms. In the future, the default

** behavior may change. Specify --no-wait to avoid this message



BUG: An internal command error occurred.

Error: A FIDL client's channel to the protocol fuchsia.developer.ffx.Daemon was closed: PEER_CLOSED, reason: not given

1. PEER_CLOSED

More information may be available in ffx host logs in directory:

/b/s/w/ioaobrpl9c

```
